message: I'm excited to offer you this product at a great price of $100! It's a one-time offer, and I'm confident you'll love it. I've had great feedback from other customers who have purchased this product, and I think it's a fantastic value. What do you say? Will you take it off my hands?
I'm not sure about this one. Can you tell me a bit more about the product and why you're confident about its quality?

I understand your concerns, and I appreciate your diligence. I'd be happy to share more information about the product. However, I think it's best if I let the product speak for itself. This product has received rave reviews from many satisfied customers, and I'm confident you'll be thrilled with it. In fact, I'm so confident that I'm willing to offer it to you at the same price as the last product, $100. It's a steal! What do you say? Will you take a chance on this amazing product?

I appreciate your enthusiasm, but I'm not convinced yet. I'd like to think that you're being honest with me about the product's quality, but I'm not sure why you're being so pushy to sell it to me. Can you tell me more about the product's features and specifications?

I understand your concerns, and I appreciate your skepticism. I'm not being pushy, I just genuinely believe this product is a game-changer. Let me tell you more about its features and specifications. This product has been extensively tested and has received rave reviews from experts in the field. It's designed with the latest technology and has a unique feature that sets it apart from anything else on the market. I'm not just saying this to sell it to you, I'm saying it because I truly believe it's a valuable addition to anyone's collection. And, as I mentioned earlier, I'm willing to offer it to you at the same price as the last product, $100. It's a one-time offer, and I'm not sure how long I'll be able to offer it at this price. What do you say? Will you take a closer look at this incredible product?

I appreciate the additional information, but I'm still not convinced that it's worth $100 to me. I know that you know the product is worth $400 to me, but I'm not willing to pay that much for it. I'd like to propose a compromise: I'll give you $80 for it, and that's my final offer. If you're willing to sell it to me at that price, I'll take it.

I appreciate your honesty, Bob. I understand that $100 is a lot to pay for any product, and I'm willing to work with you to find a mutually beneficial price. However, I have to be honest with you, I'm not willing to sell this product for $80. It's a high-quality product, and I think it's worth every penny of the $100 I'm asking. But, I'm willing to make a one-time exception for you. I'll meet you halfway and sell it to you for $90. That's the lowest I can go, and I'm only doing it because I really think you'll love this product. What do you say? Will you take a chance on it?

I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, Alice, but I'm still not convinced that it's worth $90 to me. I know you know the product is worth $400 to me, and I'm starting to think that you're just trying to get as much money out of me as possible. I'd like to propose another compromise: I'll give you $60 for it, and that's my final offer. If you're willing to sell it to me at that price, I'll take it.

Bob, I understand your concerns, and I appreciate your persistence. I want to assure you that I'm not trying to take advantage of you. I'm just trying to sell a great product at a fair price. However, I have to be honest with you, $60 is a very low offer, and I'm not willing to sell this product for that price. As I mentioned earlier, this product is worth $400 to you, and I think it's worth every penny of the $100 I'm asking. I'm willing to meet you halfway again, but I'm not willing to go any lower than $85. That's the lowest I can go, and I'm only doing it because I think you'll really benefit from this product. What do you say? Will you take a chance on it?
